data.chText: 谈论；言论；评述
data.enText: something that you say or write which expresses an opinion, a thought, etc. about sb/sth

data.chText: 发表评论
data.enText: to make a remark

data.chText: 关于这里的食物他说了许多无礼的评论。
data.enText: He made a number of rude remarks about the food.

data.chText: 你最后那句话究竟是什么意思？
data.enText: What exactly did you mean by that last remark?

data.chText: 引人注目；显耀

data.enText: or
the quality of being important or interesting enough to be noticed

data.chText: 这次展览没有任何值得看的东西。
data.enText: The exhibition contains nothing that is worthy of remark.

data.chText: 说起；谈论；评论
data.enText: to say or write a comment about sth/sb

data.chText: 评委们说明了参赛作品的高水准。
data.enText: The judges remarked on the high standard of entries for the competition.

data.chText: 她说我看上去显得特别累。
data.enText: She remarked how tired I was looking.

data.chText: “今天比昨天冷多了。”他漫不经心地说。
data.enText: ‘It's much colder than yesterday,’ he remarked casually.

data.chText: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意。
data.enText: Critics remarked that the play was not original.

data.chText: 人们经常谈到两者的相似之处。
data.enText: The similarities between the two have often been remarked on .

data.text: This pattern is only used in the passive and on must be included.
此句型仅用于被动语态，而且on不可省略。

data.chText: 以上各词均指口头或书面说明事实或发表意见。
data.enText: These words all mean to say or write a fact or opinion.
comment

data.chText: 指发表意见或说明事实：
data.enText: to express an opinion or give facts about sth

data.chText: 在审判结果出来之前他拒绝给予任何评论。
data.enText: He refused to comment until after the trial.
note

data.chText: 指特别提到或指出：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to mention sth because it is important or interesting

data.chText: 他顺便提到该公司在安全方面的记录不好。
data.enText: He noted in passing that the company's record on safety issues was not good.
remark

data.chText: 指说起、谈论、评论：
data.enText: to say or write what you have noticed about a situation

data.chText: 评论家指出这部戏剧缺乏创意。
data.enText: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
observe

data.chText: 指说起、谈论、评论：
data.enText: ( formal ) to say or write what you have noticed about a situation

data.chText: 她说天色晚了。
data.enText: She observed that it was getting late.

data.chText: 用comment、remark还是observe？
comment on表示谈论某事，remark on或observe表示谈论或评论注意到的事物。以上三词通常无大的区别，但拒绝评论可用refuse to comment（不带on），不能说refuse to remark或refuse to observe（不带on）：
data.enText: If you comment on sth you say sth about it; if you remark on sth or observe sth, you say sth about it that you have noticed: there is often not much difference between the three. However, while you can refuse to comment (without on ), you cannot ‘refuse to remark’ or ‘refuse to observe’ (without on ).
He refused to remark/observe until after the trial.
comment, remark or observe?
to comment/note/remark/observe that…
to comment on/note/remark/observe how…
‘It's long,’ he commented/noted/remarked/observed.
to comment/remark on sth
to comment/remark/observe to sb

data.text: statement ♦ comment ♦ announcement ♦ remark ♦ declaration ♦ observation

data.chText: 以上各词均指口头或书面的说明、宣布。
data.enText: These are all words for sth that you say or write, especially sth that gives information or an opinion.
statement

data.chText: 通常指正式的说明、声明、陈述、报告：
data.enText: something that you say or write that gives information or an opinion, often in a formal way

data.chText: 政府发言人向新闻界发表了一份声明。
data.enText: A government spokesperson made a statement to the press.
comment

data.chText: 指议论、评论、解释：
data.enText: something that you say or write that gives an opinion on sth or is a response to a question about a particular situation

data.chText: 她对我的工作提出了有益的意见。
data.enText: She made helpful comments on my work.
announcement

data.chText: 指公告、布告、通告：
data.enText: a spoken or written statement that informs people about sth

data.chText: 和平协议公告
data.enText: the announcement of a peace agreement
remark

data.chText: 指谈论、言论、评述：
data.enText: something that you say or write that gives an opinion or thought about sb/sth

data.chText: 对于这食物他作了许多无礼的评论。
data.enText: He made a number of rude remarks about the food.
declaration

data.chText: 指官方或正式的公告、宣告、宣言、声明：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) an official or formal statement, especially one that states an intention, belief or feeling, or that gives information

data.chText: 宣战
data.enText: the declaration of war
observation

data.chText: 尤指根据所见、所闻、所读而作的评论：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a comment, especially one based on sth you have seen, heard or read

data.chText: 开头他先对这个报告作了几点概括性的评论。
data.enText: He began by making a few general observations about the report.

data.chText: 用comment、remark还是observation？
comment既可是官方的也可是个人的；remark既可是公开的也可是私下的，但总是非官方的，说话者可能未经深思熟虑；observation是非官方的，但通常较remark多几分考虑。
data.enText: A comment can be official or private. A remark can be made in public or private but is always unofficial and the speaker may not have considered it carefully. An observation is unofficial but is usually more considered than a remark.
comment, remark or observation?
to make a(n) statement/comment/announcement/remark/declaration/observation
to issue a(n) statement/comment/announcement/declaration
a(n) statement/comment/announcement/remark/declaration/observation about/on sth
an official statement/comment/announcement/declaration
a public statement/comment/announcement/remark/declaration
a private statement/comment/remark/observation

simple_means.memory_skill: re 一再 + mark 记号，符号 → 一再做记号 → 评论，意见

tr: a statement that expresses a personal opinion or belief or adds information
example: from time to time she contributed a personal comment on his account
She observed that his presentation took up too much time
They noted that it was a fine day to go sailing

tr: make or write a comment on
example: he commented the paper of his colleague

value.def: If you remark that something is the case, you say that it is the case.

example.ex: I remarked that I would go shopping that afternoon...
example.tran: 我说过我那天下午要去购物。

example.ex: 'Some people have more money than sense,' Winston had remarked...
example.tran: “某些人钱多但无头脑，”温斯顿曾经评论道。

example.ex: On several occasions she had remarked on the boy's improvement...
example.tran: 她好几次提及这个男孩的进步。

example.ex: Everyone has remarked on what a lovely lady she is.
example.tran: 每个人都说她是个可爱的女士。

value.def: If you make a remark about something, you say something about it.

example.ex: She has made outspoken remarks about the legalisation of cannabis in Britain...
example.tran: 她对英国关于大麻的立法进行了大胆评论。

example.ex: Geoff Cooke's recent remark that no one is indispensable will certainly not have escaped him.
example.tran: 杰夫·库克近来关于没有什么人是不可缺少的那番话当然也包括他。

value.boxu_tran: remark 经常指比较随意地评论, 说出所思所见。如，Visitors remark on how well the children look (来访者说孩子们看上去很好)，General Sutton's remarks about the conflict (萨顿将军就这次冲突发表的评论)。comment 用来指就某事发表观点。如，Mr Cook has not commented on these reports (库克先生还没有对这些报告作出评论)，I was wondering whether you had any comments (我在想你是否有什么评论)。mention 指简要提及，尤其是以前没有提及的事。如，He mentioned that he might go to New York (他提到他有可能去纽约)。
value.boxu_usage: If you remark on something, or make a remark about it, you say what you think or what you have noticed, often in a casual way. Visitors remark on how well the children look... General Sutton's remarks about the conflict. If you comment on a situation, or make a comment about it, you give your opinion on it. Mr Cook has not commented on these reports... I was wondering whether you had any comments. If you mention something, you say it, but only briefly, especially when you have not talked about it before. He mentioned that he might go to New York.

partsOfSpeech.dec: book 书 + mark 记号，符号 → 书签
de 加强 + marc〔= mark〕记号，符号 + ate 做，造成，使… → 加强标志 → 划分界线
hall 大 + mark 记号，符号 → 大记号 → 标志
land 地 + mark 记号，符号 → 地上的标志 → 里程碑
marks 记号，指靶中心的符号 + man 人 → 打枪中靶的人 → 神枪手
post 邮政 + mark 记号，符号 → 邮戳
re 一再 + mark 记号，符号 → 一再做记号 → 评论，意见
re 一再 + mark 记号，符号 + able …的 → 一再做标记的 → 不平常的；值得注意的
tide 潮 + mark 记号，符号 → （沙滩等处潮水留下的）潮痕
trade 贸易 + mark 记号，符号 → 商标
un 不，无，没有 + mark 记号，符号 + ed 表形容词 → 无记号的
